medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient was first evaluated at 11 months of age for growth retardation and hypotonia. At 4 years, further assessments indicated developmental delays, walking defects, and absence of language. The patient achieved independent walking by 26 months but presented mild hypotonia during infancy. Language development was severely delayed, with the patient only pronouncing his first word at age 4 and having very poor language skills by age 16.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Episode of unprovoked, generalized tonic-clonic seizures at 6 months, controlled with anticonvulsants (phenobarbital).
